title: China Urges Diplomatic Talks, Warns of Countermeasures to Trump's Tariff Threat
snippets: China signaled Sunday that it would not back down in the face of a 100% tariff threat from President Donald Trump, urging the U.S. to resolve differences through negotiations instead of threats.
Beijing says it could introduce "countermeasures" if the US President imposes an an additional 100% tariff on Chinese imports.
Beijing says it will not back down in the face of threats, urging the US to resolve differences through negotiations.

Investors brace for another bout of trade war turmoil as Beijing says it will act if US president fails to back down Beijing has told the US it will retaliate if Donald Trump fails to back down on his threat to impose 100% tariffs on Chinese imports as investors brace for another bout of trade war t

BEIJING (AP) — China signaled Sunday that it would not back down in the face of a 100% tariff threat from President Donald Trump, urging the U.S. to resolve differences through negotiations instead of threats. U.S. Vice President JD Vance defended Trump’s position and seemed to warn China not to be
titles: China vows to stand firm against Trump's 100% tariff threat
China accuses US of 'double standards' over tariff threat
China slams Trump’s 100 percent tariff threat, defends rare earth curbs
China warns US of retaliation over Trump’s 100% tariffs threat
China vows to stand firm against Trump’s 100% tariff threat
summary: China has responded to President Trump's threat of imposing a 100% tariff on Chinese imports by urging the U.S. to seek resolution through negotiation, not threats. Beijing has warned it will introduce "countermeasures" if such tariffs are implemented. The Commerce Ministry emphasized China's consistent stance on seeking diplomatic solutions over conflict.

He did not practice Wednesday or Thursday and was a limited participant in Friday's lighter workout. M

summary: Arizona Cardinals quarterback Kyler Murray will miss Sunday's game against the Indianapolis Colts due to a foot injury sustained in Week 5. After not practicing Wednesday or Thursday and being limited on Friday, he has been placed on the inactive list before the game.

title: Blue Jays Drop Bichette for ALCS, Add Scherzer and Bassitt Against Mariners
snippets: The Blue Jays left shortstop Bo Bichette off their ALCS roster while adding Max Scherzer and Chris Bassitt. Bryan Woo, meanwhile, will return for the Mariners.
Bichette has not played since early September, but had been working his way back

Bo Bichette is not on the Toronto Blue Jays’ roster for the American League Championship Series, with Max Scherzer and Chris Bassitt the only two additions for the club’s clash with the Seattle Mariners.
titles: Bichette off Jays' ALCS roster; Woo back for M's
Bo Bichette injury update: Blue Jays shortstop off ALCS roster vs. Mariners after spraining knee
Blue Jays’ Bichette remains off roster for ALCS as Scherzer, Bassitt return
summary: The Toronto Blue Jays have excluded shortstop Bo Bichette from their American League Championship Series roster due to his inactivity since early September. Instead, they've added pitchers Max Scherzer and Chris Bassitt for their series against the Seattle Mariners, who will see the return of Bryan Woo.

title: Four Dead, 20 Injured in South Carolina Bar Shooting
snippets: A mass shooting at a crowded bar on an idyllic South Carolina island has left four people dead and at least 20 injured, officials say.
The shooting occurred just before 1 a.m., according to the sheriff's office.

BEAUFORT, S.C. (AP) — A mass shooting at a crowded bar on an idyllic South Carolina island has left four people dead and at least 20 injured, officials say. The shooting occurred early Sunday at Willie’s Bar and Grill on St. Helena Island, officials said. A large crowd was at the scene when sheriff’
titles: 4 killed and 20 more injured in shooting at a bar in South Carolina, sheriff says
At least 4 killed, 20 hurt in South Carolina bar shooting: Sheriff
4 people were killed and 20 more were injured in a shooting at a bar in South Carolina, sheriff says
summary: A mass shooting at Willie’s Bar and Grill on St. Helena Island, South Carolina, early Sunday, resulted in four deaths and at least 20 injuries. The incident took place just before 1 a.m. in a crowded bar, according to the sheriff's office.

title: Madagascar Military Unit Claims Control Amid Protests, Escalating Crisis
snippets: An army unit claimed it had taken over leadership of the military command and was now in control of all the armed forces.

Soldiers from elite Capsat unit have announced they are taking over after weeks of youth-led protests Madagascar’s president said an “attempt to seize power illegally and by force” was under way, as an elite military unit that joined protesters on the streets on Saturday announced it was taking over
Madagascar Presidency Says Attempt to Seize Power Underway Bloomberg.com
titles: Madagascar presidency says attempt to seize power under way
Madagascar’s president says illegal power grab by military is under way
Madagascar Presidency Says Attempt to Seize Power Underway - Bloomberg.com
summary: An elite military unit in Madagascar, known as Capsat, has declared that it has taken control of the country's armed forces following weeks of youth-led protests. The president of Madagascar acknowledged an ongoing illegal and forceful attempt to seize power. This development marks a significant escalation in the country's political crisis.

title: Afghanistan Kills 58 Pakistani Soldiers in Border Clash
snippets: Afghanistan said Sunday it killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, in response to what it called repeated violations of its territory and airspace.
The attacks came days after Pakistan was accused of bombing a market inside Afghanistan.
Afghanistan’s Taliban government and Pakistan traded fire overnight, marking one of the deadliest border clashes since the fall of Kabul in 2021.
titles: Afghanistan says it has killed 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations
Afghan Taliban says Pakistani troops killed in 'retaliatory' border attacks
Afghanistan and Pakistan claim to kill dozens of soldiers in border clash
summary: Afghanistan reported killing 58 Pakistani soldiers in overnight border operations, citing repeated territorial and airspace violations. The Taliban government acknowledged the loss of nine Afghan soldiers. Pakistan claimed to have seized border posts in the conflict.

Heavy rain also was forecast for southeast New England, the New York City area, and some has fallen in coastal sections of South Carolina, Oravec said.
titles: New Jersey declares state of emergency as nor'easter approaches
New Jersey declares state of emergency as nor’easter approaches
New Jersey declares state of emergency as October Nor’easter threatens to drench east coast shoreline
summary: A nor'easter moving up the East Coast led to New Jersey declaring a state of emergency. Airports announced delays and cancellations due to expected coastal flooding and strong winds. The storm also brought heavy rain forecasts for southeast New England and the New York City area, with some areas in South Carolina experiencing rainfall.

title: Oscar Winner Diane Keaton Dies at 79
snippets: Diane Keaton, who remained one of Hollywood's quirkiest and most beloved actors decades after her Academy Award-winning performance in the movie Annie Hall , has died aged 79.
Diane Keaton's first big break was in the 1970s in "The Godfather" series. She also won an Oscar in 1978 for "Annie Hall."

The legendary actor best known for her many collaborations with Woody Allen, as well as films including Reds, The First Wives Club and Book Club, has died Diane Keaton: a life in pictures Peter Bradshaw on Diane Keaton Keaton interviewed in 2023 and 2014 Jess Cartner-Morley on Keaton’s style Diane K
titles: Hollywood's quirky leading lady, Diane Keaton, dies aged 79
Diane Keaton: Oscar-winning star dies at 79
Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning star of Annie Hall and The Godfather, dies aged 79
summary: Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning actress renowned for her roles in "Annie Hall" and "The Godfather," has died at the age of 79 in California. Her career, spanning over five decades, made her a beloved figure in Hollywood. The news was confirmed by People magazine.

title: Spratly Collision Escalates China-Philippines Tensions
snippets: But China's coastguard says Manila is to blame for the latest collision in disputed waters in the Spratly archipelago.
Manila has decried the incident as a "clear threat" from China, while Beijing insists the Philippines' vessels bear "full responsibility" for the collision in the long-disputed naval region.
Philippines Says Chinese Ship Rammed Government Vessel at Sea Bloomberg.com
titles: Philippines accuses China of ramming, damaging vessel in South China Sea
Philippines says China rammed their ship in South China Sea
Philippines Says Chinese Ship Rammed Government Vessel at Sea - Bloomberg.com
summary: A collision in the disputed Spratly archipelago has escalated tensions between China and the Philippines. Beijing claims Manila's vessel bore "full responsibility," citing "ignored warnings," while Manila accuses a Chinese ship of deliberately ramming its government vessel, calling it a "clear threat." Both nations hold opposing views on the incident in the contested South China Sea region.

title: NHL Roundup: Canadiens Edge Blackhawks, Bruins Stay Undefeated
snippets: After a loss in Toronto, and an impressive win in Detroit, the Montreal Canadiens wrapped up in Chicago after three games in four nights on the road.
Cole Caufield recorded a goal and an assist, Juraj Slafkovsky buried the game-winner with just 15 seconds remaining, and the Montreal Canadiens took a 3-2 win over the Chicago Blackhawks.
Jake Neighbours found the back of the net twice, Pius Suter buried his first with his new squad and Joel Hofer made 27 saves to lift the St. Louis Blues over the Calgary Flames 4-2.
Mark Scheifele scored twice, Gabe Vilardi dished out two assists, and Connor Hellebuyck finished with 30 saves to elevate the Winnipeg Jets to a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Kings.
Aaron Ekblad, Anton Lundell and Brad Marchand all had a goal and an assist, to help the Florida Panthers handle the Ottawa Senators 6-2.

Connor Brown potted two goals while Nico Hischier and Timo Meier each tallied a goal and an assist as the New Jersey Devils earned a 5-3 win over the Tampa Bay Lightning. Max Crozier picked up two assists in the loss.

Aliaksei Protas recorded two goals and an assist while Jakob Chychrun chipped in with two helpers of his own as the Washington Capitals secured a 4-2 win over the New York Islanders. Matthew Schaefer picked up his first career NHL goal in the loss.

Pavel Zacha buried his first goal of the season to open the scoring before Mark Kastelic’s marker in the second period would end up being the game-winning goal as the Boston Bruins beat the Buffalo Sabres 3-1, improving to 3-0.
Mika Zibanejad opened the scoring with his first of the year while being shorthanded and Adam Fox scored two of his own as the New York Rangers beat the Penguins 6-1.
Kirill Marchenko scored a hat trick while Zach Werenski and Boone Jenner each added three points as the Columbus Blue Jackets beat the Minnesota Wild 7-4.

Jack McBain’s first of the season evened the score in the third period before Dylan Guenther tucked home the overtime winner as the Utah Mammoth beat the Nashville Predators 3-2, completing the comeback.
Bobby Brink scored his first goal of the season and added an assist, but Seth Jarvis walked away the hero, scoring the overtime winner as the Carolina Hurricanes beat the Philadelphia Flyers 4-3.
Thomas Harley had a goal and an assist, Jake Oettinger made 35 saves and Mikko Rantanen buried the game-winning goal to help the Dallas Stars beat the Colorado Avalanche 5-4.

Leo Carlsson scored the game-winner and tallied two assists while Mason McTavish added three helpers of his own to lift the Anaheim Ducks to a 7-6 comeback win in overtime against the San Jose Sharks.
Kaiden Guhle scored with 15.7 seconds left, and the Montreal Canadiens spoiled Chicago’s home opener with a 3-2 NHL victory over the Blackhawks on Saturday night.
titles: Call of the Wilde: Montreal Canadiens vs Chicago Blackhawks
NHL Highlights: Canadiens 3, Blackhawks 2
NHL Highlights: Blues 4, Flames 2
NHL Highlights: Jets 3, Kings 2
NHL Highlights: Panthers 6, Senators 2
NHL Highlights: Devils 5, Lightning 3
NHL Highlights: Capitals 4, Islanders 2
NHL Highlights: Bruins 3, Sabres 1
NHL Highlights: Rangers 6, Penguins 1
NHL Highlights: Blue Jackets 7, Wild 4
NHL Highlights: Mammoth 3, Predators 2
NHL Highlights: Hurricanes 4, Flyers 3
NHL Highlights: Stars 5, Avalanche 4 (SO)
NHL Highlights: Ducks 7, Sharks 6 (OT)
Guhle scores late goal as Canadiens clip Blackhawks
summary: The Montreal Canadiens secured a 3-2 victory over the Chicago Blackhawks with Kaiden Guhle scoring the game-winner in the final seconds. The St. Louis Blues defeated the Calgary Flames 4-2, while the Winnipeg Jets overcame the Los Angeles Kings 3-2. The Florida Panthers triumphed 6-2 against the Ottawa Senators, and the New Jersey Devils won 5-3 over the Tampa Bay Lightning. The Washington Capitals beat the New York Islanders 4-2, the Boston Bruins improved to 3-0 with a 3-1 win against the Buffalo Sabres, and the New York Rangers dominated the Penguins 6-1. The Columbus Blue Jackets outscored

Thanksgiving dinner is looking a bit different for one Vancouver couple this year. The normally well-stocked table, with Turkey and all the fixings, will be replaced with a takeaway turkey sandwich with cranberry sauce, and the usual dinner table conversation replaced with a much-awaited Blue Jays b
titles: Blue Jays are the bird for many this Thanksgiving
Blue Jays are the bird of choice for many this Thanksgiving
summary: A Vancouver couple's Thanksgiving dinner will not feature the traditional home-cooked meal this year. Instead, they will have a takeaway turkey sandwich with cranberry sauce, a change attributed to their plans to watch a Blue Jays baseball game.

title: Mexico Floods and Landslides Kill 41; Troops Deployed for Relief
snippets: Authorities said the death toll had risen to at least 41 amid severe flooding and landslides in the south east. Thousands of troops have been deployed to help with disaster efforts.
The downpours also damaged thousands of homes and cut off power to entire towns. More rain was expected this weekend.
Floods caused by torrential rains have killed at least 41 people in Mexico in recent days and left behind a trail of destruction, the government said Saturday.
titles: Mexico: Floods and landslides claim dozens of lives
Heavy Rain, Floods and Landslides in Mexico Kill at Least 41
At least 41 dead in Mexico floods
summary: Severe flooding and landslides in southeast Mexico have resulted in at least 41 deaths, with thousands of troops deployed for disaster relief. The heavy rains damaged homes and disrupted power, with more rain forecasted.

title: Colorado Buffaloes' Field Storming May Cost $50K, Coach Criticizes Rule
snippets: Colorado fans stormed the field after the Buffaloes' victory over No. 22 Iowa State. The act could trigger a $50,000 fine, something coach Deion Sanders was shocked to find out.
Deion Sanders Blasts Rule Change, $50K Fine for Fans Rushing Field After Colorado Win Bleacher Report
titles: Sanders endorses fans rushing field as fine looms
Deion Sanders Blasts Rule Change, $50K Fine for Fans Rushing Field After Colorado Win - Bleacher Report
summary: After the Colorado Buffaloes' win over No. 22 Iowa State, fans stormed the field, potentially incurring a $50,000 fine. Coach Deion Sanders expressed shock at the fine and criticized the rule change.

title: Tiger Woods Successfully Undergoes Seventh Back Surgery
snippets: Tiger Woods underwent lumbar disk replacement surgery Friday, his second surgery of the year along with a March procedure for a ruptured Achilles tendon and seventh back surgery since April 2014.
Tiger Woods has gone through a seventh back surgery, this time to replace a disk in his lower back and had caused pain and mobility issues.
titles: Tiger endures seventh back surgery in 11 years
Tiger Woods has seventh back surgery to have disk replaced
summary: Tiger Woods underwent his seventh back surgery, replacing a lumbar disk to address pain and mobility issues. The 15-time major winner confirmed the operation in New York was successful but has not set a timeline for his return to golf. This marks the second back surgery for the 49-year-old in just over a year.

Highlights of the Women's Super League match between Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur.

Walsh stunner sees Chelsea edge past Spurs
summary: Chelsea, the Women's Super League champions, drew their recent game against Tottenham Hotspur despite having 27 shot attempts. The match was highlighted by a moment of brilliance from Keira Walsh.

title: Israel Begins Military Withdrawal, Prepares for Hostage Release Ahead of Summit
snippets: US vice-president JD Vance says release could happen ‘any moment’ and that ‘we are on cusp of a sustainable Middle East peace’ Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu , has said that Israel is ready for the “immediate” reception of all Gaza hostages. “Israel is prepared and ready to immediately r
Key steps to be executed in the next few days will determine whether the deal between Israel and Hamas can lead to a lasting peace.
titles: Gaza ceasefire live: Trump to meet with Israeli hostages after their release by Hamas on Monday, says Vance
Gaza ceasefire holds; sides await release of hostages, prisoners
summary: Israel's military has begun withdrawing ahead of a peace summit in Egypt, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announces readiness for the immediate reception of all Gaza hostages. Forty-eight Israeli hostages are set to be released on Monday, with nearly 2,000 Palestinian detainees to follow. This comes as aid trucks enter Gaza, marking a significant step towards a potential lasting peace between Israel and Hamas.

title: Two Children Dead in Stafford, Woman Arrested on Suspicion of Murder
snippets: A 43-year-old woman is detained by police after children are pronounced dead at a domestic property.

Police say woman, 43, remains in custody after two children pronounced dead at a home in the town A woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder after the deaths of two children in Stafford, Staffordshire police have said. Police were called to a home in the town at about 7.30am on Sunday by West
titles: Murder arrest after two children found dead
Woman arrested on suspicion of murder after death of two children in Stafford
summary: Staffordshire Police are investigating after two children were pronounced dead in Stafford. A 43-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder following the incident, which was reported around 7:30 am on Sunday. Police have urged the public not to speculate as the investigation continues. The woman remains in custody.

title: Madagascar Troops Back Protests Against President, Challenge Leadership
snippets: After an elite CAPSAT unit sided with protesters in Madagascar's capital, the soldiers claimed to control the entire military. President Andry Rajoelina said an "attempt to seize power illegally" was underway.
The unit appealed to security forces in this southern African nation to disobey their superiors and to refuse to shoot at demonstrators, who have rallied in the streets for more than two weeks.
titles: Madagascar: Elite army unit turns on President Rajoelina
Fears of a Coup Rise in Madagascar as Army Unit Joins Protesters
summary: In Madagascar, elite CAPSAT troops have joined youth-led protests against utility issues, posing a significant challenge to President Andry Rajoelina. The soldiers claim to control the military and have urged security forces to support the demonstrators and not to follow orders to shoot at them. Rajoelina has described the situation as an illegal power grab. The protests have been ongoing for over two weeks.

title: Beijing Claims US Imposes New Restrictions Post-Trade Talks
snippets: Beijing accuses Washington of imposing fresh restrictions on Chinese companies after trade talks last month
US hardliners want a tough stance but the US president is taking a more nuanced approach to Beijing
Vance Says US Holds More Cards in Escalating China Trade Spat Bloomberg.com
titles: China blames Trump and US for escalating trade war
Trump talks tough with China but holds out hope of truce in trade war
Vance Says US Holds More Cards in Escalating China Trade Spat - Bloomberg.com
summary: Beijing has accused Washington of implementing new restrictions on Chinese companies following trade discussions last month. Despite some US officials advocating for a stringent approach, the President is opting for a more nuanced strategy towards Beijing. According to Bloomberg, Vance stated that the US has a stronger position in the escalating trade dispute with China.

title: UK Travelers to Face New EU Entry Rules Starting Sunday
snippets: The EU's much-delayed Entry/Exit System will change the way UK passengers travel to 29 countries.

Digital entry and exit scheme means most travellers will have to register biometric information at the border Britons travelling to EU to undergo new biometric checks at border from Sunday Many travellers to Europe will see changes in border security from Sunday with the launch of the EU’s new digit
titles: The EU's new border system explained
What is the new EU border system EES, and how will it work?
summary: Starting Sunday, UK passengers traveling to 29 European countries will experience changes due to the EU's new Entry/Exit System. This system requires most travelers to register their biometric information at the border, marking a significant shift in border security procedures for Britons visiting the EU.

title: Apple Discontinues Clips Video Editing App
snippets: Apple’s Clips video editing app is no more. It debuted in 2017 as a way to stitch together videos with music, text, and filters with a clear focus on sharing to social media. Over the years Apple added AR features and more advanced video editing tools. But recently updates had slowed to a trickle. A
Apple appears to be winding down support of Clips, with the company removing Clips from the App Store and saying it will no longer be making any updates.
titles: Apple ends support for Clips video-editing app
Apple says goodbye to the Clips app
summary: Apple has discontinued its Clips video editing app, which launched in 2017 to allow users to create videos with music, text, and filters for social media. Despite adding AR features and advanced editing tools over time, updates had recently diminished. The company has removed Clips from the App Store and confirmed it will not provide further updates.

title: China Warns US to Stop Threats, Threatens Retaliation Over Bessent's Comments

summary: China has responded to the United States by demanding it cease its threatening behavior and warned of potential retaliation. This reaction follows accusations from the US, specifically comments made by Bessent regarding Argentina, which China has labeled as bullying.

title: Trump Layoffs Intensify Government Shutdown Standoff

titles: Trump Layoffs, Shattered Trust Harden Democrats’ Shutdown Stance - Bloomberg.com
Trump Says US Troops Will Be Paid on Oct. 15 Despite Shutdown - Bloomberg.com
summary: Former President Trump's decision to lay off federal workers has intensified the U.S. government shutdown conflict, leading to a hardened stance among Democrats. Senator Patty Murray emphasized the need for compromise to reopen the government, criticizing the intimidation tactics used. The situation remains tense as both sides navigate the shutdown.
